Module opentdk.gui
Package org.opentdk.gui.application

Class BaseApplication

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
org.opentdk.gui.application.BaseApplication
public abstract class BaseApplication extends javafx.application.Application
This class gets used as extend for the main classes of JavaFX GUI applications. It provides basic methods and properties that are required to create and show GUI dialogues and components.

Sample usage:

 public class MainApp extends BaseApplication { 
        
        private SampleController controller;

        public static void main(String[] args) {
                launch();
        }

        @Override
        protected void showRootLayout() {
                try {
                        controller = (SampleController) super.showStage("Sample.fxml", "Test", super.getPrimaryStage());
                        controller.reload();
                } catch (IOException e) {
                        MLogger.getInstance().log(Level.SEVERE, e);
                        Platform.exit();
                }
        }
This would launch a simple window on the screen. The look is defined in the Sample.fxml file that can be designed with the SceneBuilder application. The controller class is in the same package than the FXML file and the sample controller skeleton can be generated with SceneBuilder as well. The title of the window is 'Test'.

Advanced usage:

Author:
LK Test Solutions

  • Constructor Details

    • BaseApplication

      public BaseApplication()

  • Method Details

    • showRootLayout

      protected abstract void showRootLayout()
      Force the sub class to load a root layout with the primaryStage to have a main window appearing with the look of the FXML file that is assigned to the main controller class.

      Example content of the method: 
       private SampleController controller;

 public static void main(String[] arguments) {
        launch();
 }
 
 try {
        controller = (SampleController) super.showStage("Sample.fxml", "Test", super.getPrimaryStage());
        controller.reload();
 } catch (IOException e) {
        MLogger.getInstance().log(Level.SEVERE, e);
        Platform.exit();
 }
      In this case the FXML file is in the same package (recommended) than the controller class and the title of the stage (window) is 'Test'.

    • init

      public void init() throws Exception
      Gets called after Application.launch(String...) was called by the sub class in the main method. The method is empty by default and is used here to initialize the MLogger class.
      Overrides:
      init in class javafx.application.Application
      Throws:
      Exception

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage) throws Exception
      Gets called after init() and is used to set the primary stage (with size properties) and implicitly call showRootLayout().
      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
      Throws:
      Exception

    • close

      public void close()
      Call this method to close the primary stage, which closes the application and stops the JavaFX application thread.

    • getChoiceBox

      public ChoiceBox getChoiceBox()
      Creates a new ChoiceBox instance with the apply button text 'dict.Apply' and the cancel button text 'dict.Cancel' that are defined in the properties file connected to the ResourceBundle. The size of the dialog has the default values of choiceBoxSize.
      Returns:
      new ChoiceBox instance

    • setChoiceBoxSize

      public final void setChoiceBoxSize(javafx.geometry.Insets size)
      Define the size of the four sides of the choice box.
      Parameters:
      size - choiceBoxSize

    • getInputDialog

      public InputDialog getInputDialog()
      Returns:
      an instance of the InputDialog object. InputDialog can be used to pass user input into the application.

    • getMessageDialog

      public MessageDialog getMessageDialog()
      Returns:
      the instance of the MessageDialog object. MessageDialog is used to display any application message like error, warning, information etc. in a pop up dialog.

    • getStyleSheet

      public String getStyleSheet()
      Returns the name and path of the style sheet (CSS file) which is used for the GUI design like colors, fonts
      Returns:
      Instance of the rootLayoutController object

    • setStyleSheet

      public void setStyleSheet(String css)
      Assigns the full path and filename of the Cascaded Style Sheet with the GUI theme (colors, fonts etc.) to the styleSheet property. This CSS file controls representation of the GUI elements of this application.
      Parameters:
      css - Full path and name of the CSS file

    • getBundle

      public ResourceBundle getBundle()
      Returns:
      resourceBundle

    • setResourceBundle

      public void setResourceBundle(ResourceBundle bundle)
      Use this method to define which resource bundle should be used to store internationalized strings.

      Example: 
       setResourceBundle(ResourceBundle.getBundle("application.test.Bundle", new Locale("en")));
      Points to a file named Bundle_en.properties that is located in the package application.test.

      Parameters:
      bundle - resourceBundle

    • showStage

      public BaseController showStage(String fxmlFile, String title, javafx.stage.Stage stage) throws IOException
      Show a new stage on the screen. For an example usage see BaseApplication().
      Parameters:
      fxmlFile - The FXML file that defines the looks of the stage.
      title - Text on the top of the window.
      stage - The javafx.application.Stage object that should be used. If unknown use showStage(String, String) to simply pass new Stage().
      Returns:
      BaseController instance that controls the FXMl file.
      Throws:
      IOException - if any IO error occurs

    • createComponent

      public BaseController createComponent(String fxmlFile) throws IOException
      Similar to showStage(String, String, Stage) but used to embed container into an existing parent stage.
      Parameters:
      fxmlFile - The FXML file that defines the looks of the container.
      Returns:
      BaseController instance that controls the FXMl file.
      Throws:
      IOException - if any IO error occurs
